title-group.article-title: TRENDS IN PRIVATISATION IN THE ARAB WORLD AND ITS PROBLEMS AND PROSPECTS

abstract.p: Most of the Arab States Confronted with low oil price, large budget deficit and public debt, lower inward foreign remittances and overall recessionary environment, require a structural reform like privatisation. The privatisation will reduce the financial burdens of the Arab Governments and contribute to the balanced growth of the domestic economies. This article attempts to address the recent trends, developments and economic implications of privatisations in the Arab World and its problems, prospects and pre-requisites. The major problems of privatisation include lack of competitiveness of SOEs, the large financial obligations of SOEs, lack of developed, adequate and efficient capital markets, monopolies in certain industrial sectors, political and cultural barriers, excess labour and higher wage levels and investment behaviour of private investors. Each Individual Arab country has to formulate strategies according to its unique political and socio-economic factors and to the particular problems and issues facing its industries. Appropriate strategies addressing various issues and problems are presented.
